results.title: Between cultures
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman explores human relationships between cultures and the struggle to obtain cultural identity. The theme is gradually unfolded through interviews with Morag Loh, co-author of “The Immigrants” and discussion with people personally involved with the struggle between cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.description: Peter Couchman explores human relationships between cultures and the struggle to obtain cultural identity. The theme is gradually unfolded through interviews with Morag Loh, co-author of “The Immigrants” and discussion with people personally involved with the struggle between cultures.

results.title: Sons and lovers 'the dark forest' [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Terry Monagle and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Terry Monagle leads a discussion with a group of students in a program designed to aid understanding of the main characters of D H Lawrence’s novel in the context of the themes which concerned Lawrence in the writing of the novel.

results.title: Our pandas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A look at the pandas Fei Fei and Xiao Xiao during their visit to their visit to the Melbourne Zoo in 1988. The program includes interviews with their Australian and Chinese keepers.

results.title: Life and study at the university
results.brief_description: Ilustrates aspects of university life: getting a degree, studying, campus club, religious organizations, political groups, learning to think and be analytical and making friends. It concludes showing a number of famous students who choose careers completely different from those for which they studied.
results.description: Ilustrates aspects of university life: getting a degree, studying, campus club, religious organizations, political groups, learning to think and be analytical and making friends. results.title: Health down under
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: An expert panel answers questions from a group of senior postprimary students about some aspects of reproductive health such as how to prevent cervical cancer and STDs.

results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Sunrise, Sunset: Moni and George
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Some of the changes occurring in Australia in Australian industry. are examined in this programme. The episode looks at what has been the success of such changes. Moni, a bank employee, and George, an airport services co-ordinator, give their points of view.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group

results.title: Teaching nutrition: cross age tutoring
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: A short program for teachers to view before they become involved in nutrition education. It uses the cross age tutoring approach but the message is equally important regardless of the teaching strategies to be used. For both primary and secondary teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit

results.title: Having a say: Helene
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Helen came to Australia from France and found difficulty in fitting in. Language was a basic factor in her problem, but through English in the Workplace, her life changed as did her work satisfaction level.
